gross_motor: Encourage tummy time for 10-15 minutes daily
Place colorful toys just out of reach to encourage crawling
Practice standing with support using furniture
Play ball games - rolling, throwing, kicking
Create safe spaces for climbing and exploring
Dance together to music with different rhythms
Walk on different surfaces (grass, sand, carpet)
fine_motor: Provide blocks or cups for stacking practice
Offer finger foods to develop pincer grasp
Give crayons and paper for scribbling
Play with shape sorters and simple puzzles
Use playdough for squeezing and molding

receptive_language: Name objects and people around them consistently
Play simple games like 'Where is your nose?'
Use simple, clear commands during daily routines
Sing songs with actions and gestures
Point to and name body parts during bath time
expressive_language: Repeat and expand on their words
Ask simple questions and wait for responses
Narrate your daily activities as you do them
Encourage imitation of sounds and words
Use simple sentences when talking to them
Sing nursery rhymes and encourage participation

social_emotional: Play peek-a-boo and other interactive games
Arrange regular playtime with other children
Respond warmly and consistently to their emotions
Encourage pretend play with dolls or toys
Show affection through hugs and smiles
